tweets.text:
#DidYouKnow rainfall can wash dog poo into bathing waters through the surface water drains and streams, even if you're far from the beach?
 
Make sure you bag up your dog's poo and put it in the bin.

#BagItBinIt #BinIt4Beaches #RespectProtectEnjoy https://t.co/gnpjBUl8jX

Field operations teams are out across the North West today clearing debris screens to reduce flood risk like here at Bessy Brook in Horwich near #Bolton.  

There's lots of rain around this week, keep following us for all the latest flood risk updates. https://t.co/tJSwpdZb4K

"We constantly innovate to do more with less. But ultimately we will get the environment we pay for. A core part of that is funding the @EnvAgency properly."

tweets.text:
@Feargal_Sharkey @TerryMac999 @EnvAgency Appointed Board member July 2009
Ministerial appointment, reappointed for third term, January 2015.
Appointed Deputy Chair July 2015
Appointed Acting Chair January 2016
Appointed Chair September 2016

Chair of Audit and Risk Assurance Committee (until Feb 2016) -  + more

Yes good to see some analysis to explain the capacity gap that exists between rising environmental ambitions & the ability to deliver on that. @NaturalEngland & @EnvAgency ready to do the job, but we need the means https://t.co/bEZkSXnDPm

Brilliant @Unchecked_UK report shows effects of severe funding cuts at @NaturalEngland & @EnvAgency on enforcement. They need major capital & revenue investment at #SpendingReview to fulfil current functions, let alone deliver the #EnvironmentBill & #ELM.

https://t.co/CCvpt8Gk7O

More than half of waste operators could be breaking the law by misclassifying hazardous waste and firms could find their compliance costs skyrocketing. The @EnvAgency  says the matter is a ‚Äòpriority‚Äô and the sector fears a crackdown @ConorMcG1one reports
https://t.co/oKfbM2cJJe

@janegarvey1 @charlottebsmith @BBCWomansHour @EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @CleanIlkley Most definitely the Rethink Nature charity group CEOs üòÄ https://t.co/ZNo6sgBk5p 
including @perkins58 @JulieWilliamsBC @KitStoner @BeccyRSPB plus @MarianSpain who ran Plantlife before moving to be CEO of @NaturalEngland #workingtogether

How come @robertjenrick Planning White Paper has NO detail and asks for NO feedback on the #environmental, #biodiversity and #heritage effects of the plans? If are planned protections are purposefully unclear. @NaturalEngland  @HistoricEngland @EnvAgency https://t.co/jSDlzodRaK

tweets.text:
I have to say that after all of the years I've been involved in senior management, policy, strategy, comms, I don't think I've ever heard anyone so badly briefed as the chair of the @EnvAgency. 

https://t.co/bWoT0e22jP

Despite restrictions our amazing #volunteers are making a big impact, restoring N Devon #Culmgrasslands. Brash & logs from scrub clearance on site were used to construct habitat piles for inverts, herptiles, birds & mammals. @Interreg2Seas @DevonCC @EnvAgency @RossCherrington https://t.co/qQbguAFXye

Our Culm grassland project has started its winter works, clearing scrub at Stowford Moor Commons. Here they are with some wonderful volunteers in the sunshine!
#CulmGrassland @Interreg2Seas @DevonCC @EnvAgency. https://t.co/gIznahKP5u
@Ilkley_BM @EmmaHowardBoyd EBH joined the board of the @EnvAgency in 2009. What has she done about it during the last 11 years? @BBCWomansHour

@Feargal_Sharkey @paulcotswolds @EnvAgency Enables it? Turns blind eye at best. Excuses it as necessary. Certainly nothing to prevent it.  #Windrushagainstsewagepollution are the best scientific "action" against river pollution we have along with @Feargal_Sharkey. @paulcotswolds best "action" politician on R Windrush west

WATCH: Here‚Äôs Dave in the rewilded #Surbiton Stream in south-west London. 

Working to restore rivers for wildlife and for the future! 
#LRW2020 #LondonRiversWeek @RBKingston https://t.co/ZGU8kSbvOz

@CleanIlkley @EmmaHowardBoyd @BBCWomensHour @KarenShackleto5 The very people who created this sorry situation are now trying to suggest they can fix it. 

I've said it before the @EnvAgency have no credibility left in this conversation.
@WSCCNews depsite no flood alerts issued, second consecutive night of #flooding in Hassocks. #westsussex
@TerryMac999 @EnvAgency Joined the board of the EA in 2009. You would have hoped would have picked up something by now.

Our staff have been working with @EnvAgencyMids and @BhamCityCouncil to renaturalise parts of the River Cole, adding curve, creating habitats & improving conditions for fish and invertebrate population movements. It‚Äôs part of our vision to improve the river for wildlife & people https://t.co/4xPmOEt3Aa

This time last year #StormCiara & #StormDennis brought devastating floods to Staffordshire. Today we mark that event with tweets about what we are working on to help mitigate flooding #naturalfloodmanagement #naturebasedsolutions @EnvAgency @theriverstrust @TrentCaba @WildStoke https://t.co/F8Y2Lk1Rgw

@Steveyp11 @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Spoke to the fishermen this morning during my dog walk, not good, they were disgusted. 5am discharge apparently, large volume of raw sewage, very sneaky early hours so on a normal night no one would notice, ruined the night match and lots went home. Not acceptable!!!!!

tweets.text: We are working in multiple catchments delivering #naturebasedsolutions through #naturalfloodmanagement. We work with landowners to create storage pools, wetlands & leaky dams which all help to #slowtheflow of water as well as clean it & provide wonderful habitat @EnvAgency https://t.co/7PkzJBXb2A

After Marchington village suffered flooding we are working alongside the @EnvAgency to mitigate the effects. We are working with landowners higher up in the catchment to store water & #slowtheflow with features like storage pools and #woodydebris https://t.co/fybtF1Jft4

#NaturalFloodManagement is a key tool in mitigating the effects of extreme weather. We are working with partners across catchments in the county to #slowtheflow & store water whilst also creating wildlife habitat @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @StaffordshireCC @SoTCityCouncil https://t.co/7mvhiUCQjp

Separate collection is vital for high-quality recycling - and recycling schemes need to be easy, safe, and effective in returning packaging to the loop. 

Learn how glass can close the packaging loop and drive a #CircularEconomy:
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency New to the job? Maybe distracted by other commitments such as joining the Board of Trade?

Look who was found in the #Thames recently! Historically a common sight, the migratory Twaite shad is now rare and it was great to see it near Blackfriars in Central London! #WorldFishMigrationDay #LRW2020 #LondonRiversWeek #TidewayLondon https://t.co/MjBH1APVkg
@janegarvey1 @BBCWomansHour @EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @CleanIlkley Please state that no rivers in England past the pollution levels - they are all polluted!!

Diggers return to #Seaford beach today - as @EnvAgencySE starts moving shingle along the beach to protect the town from coastal flooding

Parts of the beach will be closed for 4 weeks. 

https://t.co/C0IWUn6cb4 https://t.co/rqC5lyotSO

@janegarvey1 @BBCWomansHour @EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @CleanIlkley When the publicly funded national broadcaster is used to promote a political ideology you know it just has to go.

#DefundTheBBC

Scientists are now testing sewage samples to detect local #coronavirus outbreaks, even when people don't show symptoms.

This is a valuable step in supporting NHS Test and Trace.

Find out more: https://t.co/JEJxbk0ofA

#CovidSewageTesting @DHSCgovuk @EnvAgency https://t.co/4xdR82CtJo

The UK has made a breakthrough in using science to tackle #coronavirus.  

Scientists can now use sewage to detect local outbreaks, even when people don't show symptoms.  

Find out more: https://t.co/JEJxbjIMR0 

#CovidSewageTesting @DHSCgovuk @EnvAgency https://t.co/vW5ratcTmN

urls.title: Sewage signals early warning of coronavirus outbreaks
urls.description: Government-led programme is providing an early warning of coronavirus outbreaks by monitoring sewage and sharing data with NHS Test & Trace

tweets.text: @Bobziz @Ilkley_BM @EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @BBCWomansHour You're conflating two very different concepts. Oh any by the way, the EA's budget has actually increased over the last 5 years. You might find that the board has chosen to spend the money on something else other than the environment.
@Ilkley_BM @EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @BBCWomansHour But the very people who got us into this mess now want us to believe that they are going to fix it. Trust us!
@Feargal_Sharkey @EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @BBCWomansHour It‚Äôs taken a public campaign to bring this stage front to regulators. Now it‚Äôs there we have to be part of the solution
